books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A classic American novel about the Jazz Age and the American Dream. Set in the summer of 1922, it follows Nick Carraway as he observes the tragic story of his mysterious neighbor Jay Gatsby.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A gripping tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South. Through the eyes of Scout Finch, we witness her father's courageous defense of a black man falsely accused of rape.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian social science fiction novel about totalitarian control. Winston Smith struggles against the oppressive regime of Big Brother in a world where truth is constantly rewritten.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A romantic novel about manners, upbringing, and marriage in Georgian England. Elizabeth Bennet navigates the complex world of social expectations and finds love with the proud Mr. Darcy.

books.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
books.author: Stieg Larsson
books.description: A psychological thriller about a journalist and a hacker investigating a wealthy family's dark secrets. Mikael Blomkvist teams up with the enigmatic Lisbeth Salander in this gripping Nordic noir.

books.title: Gone Girl
books.author: Gillian Flynn
books.description: A psychological thriller about a marriage gone terribly wrong. When Amy Dunne disappears on her wedding anniversary, her husband Nick becomes the prime suspect in this twisted tale of deception.

books.title: The Da Vinci Code
books.author: Dan Brown
books.description: A mystery thriller involving art, history, and secret societies. Robert Langdon races through Paris and London to solve a murder that reveals a conspiracy spanning centuries.

books.title: Dune
books.author: Frank Herbert
books.description: An epic space opera set in a distant future where noble houses fight for control of the desert planet Arrakis, the only source of the universe's most valuable substance.

books.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
books.author: Douglas Adams
books.description: A comedic science fiction series about space travel. Arthur Dent is swept off Earth just before its destruction and embarks on a hilarious journey through the galaxy.

books.title: Neuromancer
books.author: William Gibson
books.description: A cyberpunk novel that defined the genre. Case, a washed-up computer hacker, is hired for one last job that takes him into cyberspace and corporate espionage.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: An epic high fantasy adventure in Middle-earth. Frodo Baggins must destroy the One Ring to save his world from the Dark Lord Sauron in this timeless tale of good versus evil.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: A young wizard discovers his magical heritage and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he uncovers the truth about his parents' death.

books.title: A Game of Thrones
books.author: George R.R. Martin
books.description: Political intrigue and fantasy in the Seven Kingdoms. Noble families vie for control of the Iron Throne while an ancient evil awakens in the north.

books.title: The Notebook
books.author: Nicholas Sparks
books.description: A timeless love story that spans decades. Noah and Allie's passionate romance is tested by social differences and the passage of time in this emotional tale.

books.title: Outlander
books.author: Diana Gabaldon
books.description: Time travel romance between a WWII nurse and 18th-century Highlander. Claire Randall is mysteriously transported back in time where she meets Jamie Fraser.

books.title: Me Before You
books.author: Jojo Moyes
books.description: An emotional story about love, loss, and living life to the fullest. Louisa Clark becomes a caregiver for Will Traynor, a quadriplegic man who changes her perspective on life.

books.title: Sapiens
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: A brief history of humankind and our species' development. From the Stone Age to the Silicon Age, this book explores how Homo sapiens came to dominate the world.

books.title: Educated
books.author: Tara Westover
books.description: A memoir about education, family, and the struggle for self-invention. Tara Westover grows up in a survivalist family and eventually earns a PhD from Cambridge University.

books.title: Atomic Habits
books.author: James Clear
books.description: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones. This practical guide reveals how tiny changes can lead to remarkable results over time.
